p: The civil unrest in a country can weaken the strength of health care systems or the health security of a nation and can delay the early detection of a disease outbreak. There is a direct correlation between civil unrest areas and emerging infections, as was documented in SARS in Southern China and the H1N1 flu in Mexico. Other examples include the Ebola and Nipah outbreaks that illustrated how social disruption and the threat of violence can trigger people to migrate to na√Øve forest lands, where they rely on nontraditional foods, animals such as bats, rodents, or primates, which can greatly elevate the risk of zoonotic spillover [ 86].
